subsections.title: Receiver Sensitivity and Selectivity
subsections.label: subsec:rx-sense-select
prompts: Explain the concept of receiver sensitivity in radio technology, including how it is measured and its importance in detecting weak signals.
Describe the concept of receiver selectivity, focusing on how it allows a receiver to discriminate between multiple signals and its role in reducing interference.
Compare and contrast sensitivity and selectivity, highlighting their respective roles in receiver performance.

subsections.label: subsec:mixer-osc
